availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, clerk. Maryland native. Married to Ann Elliott Duvall in Fayette County, Kentucky, on August 24, 1835. Father of Henry Duvall, Virginia Duvall, Claudius Duvall, Louis Eugene Duvall, Alexander Duvall, and Mary E. Duvall. Accountant in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Clerk in Louisville in 1860. Hired one enslaved person in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 2, p. 771.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, p. 269A.
